column9: This is my second round on clomid. Side effects include hot flashes and fullness of breasts. But these are small hurdles to jump while keeping the goal of pregnancy in the background. Although the symptoms can make you feel like you want to relax, it's so important to keep active during this time. Get at least 30 mins of exercise per day. While taking clomid,I recommend getting the hsg test to make sure your fallopian tubes and uterus are okay. The test is not as painful as some people make it seem to be. (You can bring a stress ball.) Next, you should also have an ultrasound of your ovaries to make sure that the follicle is being produced. These things take time, but, as women, we should be able to multi-task to solve the infertility problem as quickly as we possibly can. When in doubt, pray to St. Gerard, the patron Saint of Motherhood.  Good luck to all and please continue sharing your stories and advice.

column9: I'm 25, my husband and I have been trying to get pregnant for 18 months and one year ago I was diagnosed with PCOS. I had taken Clomid for two months before the Metformin started to regulate my period and it didn't work (although that time I had no side effects from it), so we waited until we got results on the Metformin for a couple months and then started taking Clomid again. I have experienced severe nausea and diareaha from the Metformin, but found that taking two Immodium AD pills every night when I take the Metformin helps that significantly. column9: My husband and I have been trying to get pregnant for 2 years and have had no success.  I tried clomid for two months and had no success but that was because I was taking it improperly.  I have since gotten a new Dr which specializes in Infertility and have no complaints thus far even though I am only on my first month.  For all of you who have been asking when to take clomid, I would strongly suggest that you speak with your doctor.  You need to have your medical history checked, get a physical exam, and have your husbands semen analysis before beginning clomiphene.  My doctor also prescribed Metformin at 500mg.  I take Metformin three times a day and I started taking clomid on day 3-7 of my cycle.  I was instructed to then wait until day 12 to start trying.  On Day 17 I am to start Prochieve which is something that I would suggest for all of you out there who have miscarried or are taking clomid.  It is supposed to increase the cervical fluid which should reduce chances for miscarrying.  I was told to make love every other day starting on day 12.  On day 21 I am to get my progest. levels checked to find out if I ovulated and then start the whole process again if no baby.  I would strongly suggest that anyone who has not spoken to a doctor speak to one before starting these drugs.  I have been through two doctors already not because there was no success but b/c I thought there was not enough attention given to my situation.  This new Dr has prescribed Metformin, Clomid, Prochieve & Provera (to start my period) which the other DR mentioned nothing about Metformin.  So I am prayerful that it works the first time around.  You are all in my prayers.  I never knew there were that many of us out there.  May God Bless you all with your hearts desire.
